rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C90002

definition: The type of nonclinical study performed e.g. pharmacokinetics, safety pharmacology and toxicology.
name: Study Category

terms.definition: The branch of toxicology that deals with adverse effects of chemical, physical or biological agents on genetic material.
Science that deals with the characteristics, effects, and uses of drugs and their interactions with living organisms.

The characteristic movements of drugs within biological systems, as affected by absorption, distribution, binding, elimination, biotransformation, and excretion; particularly the rates of such movements. (NCI)
The branch of toxicology that deals with adverse effects of chemical, physical or biological agents on reproduction and development.

A branch of pharmacology that investigates the potential undesirable pharmacodynamic effects of a substance on physiological functions in relation to exposure in the therapeutic range and above. (safetypharmacology.org) (NCI)
Toxicology is the study of the adverse effects of chemical, physical or biological agents on people, animals, and the environment.
